text: The Innovation Master Series is the only
class that I know of where it's all
senior professors people who've been
teaching design at Stanford for 20 or 30
years who come together and give their
best 90 minutes of teaching content
exercises and takeaways so you really
are learning from um you know the best
of the best here at Stanford and people
who've been studying Innovation for a
long long
time people who are in a situation where
they have to make those decisions or are
general managers of a group um that is
really struggling uh to come up with new
ideas um people who want to work on how
to they may they may feel they have
Innovative organizations but their teams
don't work as effectively together as
they might um certainly people who are
struggling to understand well I spend a
lot of money on Innovation but I don't
really know what I get for
it the way you get data is your
prototype so we're a prototype-based
design methodology and design thinking
relies on that so we have as a as a as a
consequence of that some of the best
prototyping labs in the world here
you'll have an opportunity to see what
we call the product realization lab
where we build not only products but
experiences and services the biomedics
robot lab where we've built robots that
fly and land like birds or can climb up
the sides of buildings like a gecko a
center for Automotive Research at
Sanford art what we call our cars lab
where the autonomous vehicles that won
the DARPA challenge that have done the
um Pikes Peak race these are cars that
drive themselves will be there the solar
car will be there
I would hope to see you come to campus
um I guarantee you the three days will
be you know full of information full of
activities and you'll meet some of the
most interesting um participants and
instructors uh in any conference you've
ever been
to e
